description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development PCR 2: Protective and learning environment PCR 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: Eight states developed a convergent adolescent programme approach with a defined basic package of intervention, messages and result matrix facilitating scalable models for adolescent empowerment and ending child marriage reaching nearly half a million girls and boys through at least one intervention and over one million parents and community members. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of States with an endorsed communication strategy and materials to promote understanding and adoption of life skills on menstrual hygiene management

target.value: 2016:3 states - Bihar, Jharkhand and Uttar Pradesh

title.narrative: Knowledge base on adolescents for relevant policies and programmes, available to government and other partners

target.value: 2016:Concurrent monitoring studies for menstrual hygiene & adolescents completed in Uttar Pradesh, evaluation design for MH intervention finalised, 1 assessment study in 3 states, 1 assessment of AEP &

title.narrative: Number of relevant government departments/ programs at national and state level dealing with adolescent issues (including HIV and AIDS) have appropriate strategies for engaging adolescents, ensuring their participation and promoting appropriate practices and social norms

target.value: 2016:3 programmes (RKSK including MHM, SABLA & NACO) at national level and 7 out of 15 states

title.narrative: Number of most excluded and vulnerable adolescents in selected areas who have the knowledge, skills and confidence to address issues affecting their lives
